title: Sheikh Hasina
summary: Sheikh Hasina Wazed (née Sheikh Hasina; /ˈʃeɪk həˈsiːnə/ SHEKH ha-si-na; Bengali: শেখ হাসিনা ওয়াজেদ, romanized: Shēkh Hasinā, Bengali pronunciation: ['ʃekʰ ɦɐsina]; born 28 September 1947)[1] is the Prime Minister of Bangladesh. She was sworn-in to office in January 2019 after her political party won a landslide in the 2018 Bangladesh general elections. Sheikh Hasina is the longest serving prime minister in the history of Bangladesh, having served for a combined total of over seventeen years and four terms, similar to Tony Blair or Angela Merkel. Hasina is the daughter of father of the nation of Bangladesh, Sheikh Mujibur Rahman, and the eldest daughter among his five children.[2]
